nodes.bodyText: @romartin @hasys  the editor is not showing upon opening the index.html and only way to make it show was to include these two lines. Removing one of them prevents the tests from seeing the editor.

Hey @domhanak  @hasys
We've to be careful on this yeah, good catch, lemme explain:

The editor's setContent() method returns a Promise, it means the response is asynchronous
The API is intentionally done this way because editor's, during loading, are also performing arynchronous operations (eg: fetching icons, other services). So once the editor "completes" loading the content being set, it properly resolves the promise.

It means doing a double setContent call to the editor, although seems to make it work properly, it's NOT correct, it's not the expected way to use it. Errors can appear from this point. You've to properly follow the API...
Soo I think the right fix is just about taking into account the Promise return type, once calling the setContent method, and please do not call it twice! :)
Lemme know if any Qs. Thanks!

There's a synchronous Promise in appformer (somewhere) that you can use to replace the default asynchronous one... @ederign can probably jump straight to where it is (as IIRC it's used by some appformer tests too).

setContent is a helper method (naming just says what it does) that executes
((JavascriptExecutor) driver).executeScript(String.format(SET_CONTENT_TEMPLATE, ""));
How should I properly follow the API? When I execute the script manually on test page in console, it loads the editor right away. And I can see in console that it returned a Promise but it's state is pending even after the editor is loaded and content resolved.
Not sure I follow, in DMN test suite just executing this once ((JavascriptExecutor) driver).executeScript(String.format(SET_CONTENT_TEMPLATE, "")); shows the editor.  I do not understand the difference.
I am a bit confused, the idea is that I will use the Promise from appformer to call setContent in tests, correct?
@hasys this id changes every time we open the process. Is that expected?

+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

nodes.bodyText: Hi @domhanak, yes, it is known issue, see https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-1795

nodes.bodyText:
This can be simplified:
        final WebElement designer = waitOperation()
                .withMessage("Diagram panel is a prerequisite for all tests. " +
                            "its absence is indicator of designer load fail.")
                .until(presenceOfElementLocated(className(DIAGRAM_PANEL)));
